details.flavorText: While the leaders of larger spriggan enclaves tend to be uniquely trained warriors with highly specialized skills, spriggan warlords are fond of the traditional spriggan weaponry of morningstar and crossbow, valuing this traditional fighting style for its simplicity and for using both weapons to their full potential. Spriggan warlords often serve as sub-commanders in large groups, filling roles in spriggan society akin to captains of the guard or bodyguards to spriggan royalty. In smaller groups or remote outposts, a single spriggan warlord is typically in charge of a band of spriggan bullies.

description.value:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Heightened The duration increases to 1 hour.

A high-frequency sonic attack shatters a nearby object. You deal 2d10 sonic damage to the object, ignoring the object's Hardness if it is 4 or lower.

Heightened The damage increases by 1d10, and the Hardness the spell ignores increases by 2.

You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you succeed against a spell effect, you counteract it. If you succeed against a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

target.value: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

description.value:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 1.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 2.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 3 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fleeing]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened You can target up to five creatures.

The target's form appears blurry. It becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target's location obvious, the target can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

Trigger The spriggan warlord takes damage; Effect The spriggan warlord grows to size Large, along with their equipment (which returns to natural size if removed). The spriggan warlord's reach increases by 5 feet. They regain 15 Hit Points and gain a [[/r +2 # status bonus to melee attack and damage]] status bonus to melee attack and damage rolls. This effect continues until the end of the spriggan warlord's next turn, but on any turn in which the spriggan warlord deals damage to another creature and is not @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fatigued]{Fatigued}, the effect extends until the end of the following turn. When Enraged Growth ends, the spriggan warlord is fatigued for 1 hour.
The spriggan warlord makes a morningstar Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. This attack is nonlethal.

The spriggan warlord's Strikes deal an additional [[/r 2d6 # precision damage]] precision damage to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} creatures.
When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.
A spriggan warlord has access to the critical specialization effects for crossbows and morningstars, and the reload of any crossbow they wield is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0).
